In a message dated 7/11/03 7:27:11 AM Central Daylight Time, 
Proudwing500k@... writes:


> Tyrael: I admit it. No Decepticon was ever a slave. Too stubborn and
> violent to be one, and way too deceptive. But you will never be the
> power you once were. Clinging to that fading dream is futile and vain.
> It wastes your efforts. Whatever plan Alpha Trion had for you, it
> might not be one that includes giving you commands. You play the part
> he has given you, just as I am playing a part given to me by my ancestors.
> 
> He raises a hand and unleashes a massive surge of coherent light at
> Maxima.
> 
> 

Falling to her weakened knees. This was becoming more than she could bear. 
Feeling the pain shooting through her. She would not use whatever powers may 
have been given to her. 

She glared up at Tyrael. "If you know so much about me, & what Alpha Trion 
wishes of me, why do I not know?!" she spat. "Besides... I am one of your bloody 
damn ancestors!" she cringed. She was no direct foremother of his, but 
surely, the vast majority of these bots & cons she was much older, though easy 
enough for her to change & grow & adjust. Though at times, she didn't like it or 
hesitated. She changed nonetheless. 

She grabbed more strength. She wanted to show she was stronger than any had 
thought.

Struggling, she finally came to her feet again. Panting, "Eeehhh... Tyrael. 
Again, Alpha Trion does NOT govern my future, just as he did not govern my 
past. He was an Autobot. I am a Decepticon." An evil grin appeared upon her face 
as her crimson optics glowed. "Actually, I truly enjoyed torturing him often... 
even with the demise of Elita-1. Oh, the pain from both Optimus Prime & Alpha 
Trion was priceless." she purred wickedly.

--part1_1d5.da4b197.2c40544b_boundary
